results.title: Breakaway
results.brief_description: A girl dressed as an angel runs through an underground train station. An experimental film composed of surreal moments and psychological drama filmed in classic expressionist style.

results.title: Break of day
results.creator_credit: Patricia Lovell, Clare Beach Films and Ken Hannam
results.brief_description: Tom (Andrew McFarlane) was one of the lucky ones; he returned from the nightmare of Gallipoli - partially crippled, but alive. At a time when his life should be full and happy, he is restless and angry and can’t adjust back to his hometown or young wife. Then he meets a free-thinking artist, Alice, and her passion and sexuality shocks everyone in town except Tom, who looks to her for an awakening from his nightmare. Cast includes Sara Kestelman, Andrew McFarlane, Tony Barry and John Bell.

results.title: Break down the barriers
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions, Queensland National Fitness Council and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: Illustrates how disabled people are breaking down the barriers which, until recently, often precluded their participation in any other than stereotyped recreational activities. Demonstrates such recreational activities as grass skiing, canoeing, lawn and ten pin bowling, swish, rifle shooting, scuba diving, hang gliding, disco and square dancing etc. Commentary by Stan Pretty.

results.title: Break & enter
results.creator_credit: Melanie Coombs, Cinemedia Corporation, XYZ Entertainment and Amanda Brotchie
results.brief_description: A routine home invasion leads to a comedic exploration of gender and identity when a middle aged housewife swaps roles with the intruder who intended to rob her but was foiled by a frying pan. Cast includes Mark Peglar, Marion Heathfield and Robin Cummings with a music score by Mick Harvey.

results.title: Bread of eternal life
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Labella, Franco Zeffirelli and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: in the temple of Sanhedrin; Joseph of Arimathea, Nicodemus and Caiaphas; Judas visits with Zerah in his quarters in the temple; the last supper; Jesus breaks bread with his disciples and gives them the commandment of love; Jesus predicts he will be betrayed by Judas.

results.title: Bread is life
results.brief_description: The story of the Bread Research Institute of the CSIRO and what it does including: analysing flour samples and experimenting with proportion of gluten in the flour mix; experimenting with machines for making bread; methods of storing flour; analysing faulty loaves and offering advice to improve quality.

results.title: Bread and tulips = Pane e tulipani
results.creator_credit: Daniele Maggioni, Monogatari and Silvio Soldini
results.brief_description: Bread and tulips is an Italian comedy directed by Silvio Soldini, starring his wife, Licia Maglietta. It is the story of Rosalba, a suburban housewife, living in Pescara, Italy with her two teenage sons and boorish husband. On a tour of Italy with her family Rosalba is accidentally left behind at a depot as the bus departs without her. Dismayed that her family could allow this to happen, Rosalba heads back to Pescara, but on a whim decides to take a side trip to Venice, a city she has always longed to see. Once there, Rosalba begins to question the meaning of her life and the role that she plays in the family unit. Rosalba takes up residency in Vencie, engaging with many colourful characters including, Fernando Girasoli (Bruno Ganz), a depressed Finnish waiter, who offers Rosalba a place to stay and Grazia, (Marina Massironi), his eccentric neighbour, a holistic masseuse. Meanwhile, back in Pescara, Rosalba’s domineering husband, who is not coping domestically in her absence, sends an amateur sleuth (Guiseppe Battiston) to search for her. Shot on location in Venice, “Bread and tulips” explores notions of identity and of discovering the meaning of life. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Bread and roses
results.creator_credit: Robin Laing, Preston-Laing Productions and Gaylene Preston
results.brief_description: Originally made for television, this is a drama in four parts based on the autobiography of Sonja Davies, New Zealand activist and parliamentarian. It spans 20 years- beginning during World War II when Sonja falls in love with an American Soldier. Pregnant and unwed, Sonja learns that he will not return and once her daughter Penny is born, she returns to nursing to support her. In illness she is reunited with an old boyfriend, Charlie, who aids her recovery. Together they experience great difficulties with shortsighted officialdom, and in response become actively involved in local politics. Sonja particularly finds political strength amongst women and socialist sympathisers, and together they embark on a struggle to ensure that others will share the peace and prosperity of a post war New Zealand. Cast includes Genevieve Picot, Mick Rose, Donna Akersten, Tina Regtien and Erik Thompson.
